questions.question_text:
A security architect is reviewing the options for performing input validation on incoming web form submissions. Which of the following should the architect as the
MOST secure and manageable option?

discussion.content: This question was on the exam (october-2020)

Selected Answer: C
C. alert tcp any any -> any 21 (content: "root")

This rule specifies that the IDS should generate an alert when it detects a TCP connection from any source IP and any source port to any destination IP on port 21 (FTP), and the content of the traffic contains the string "root." This rule specifically looks for FTP login attempts that involve the username "root."
What sort of idiot created this question?! They couldn't type out the options? My god
This question was on the exam
LOL. CompTIA have nicked this question from CEH v6. Answer B is good for Snort.

questions.question_text:
A security administrator needs to create an IDS rule to alert on FTP login attempts by root. Which of the following rules is the BEST solution?
//IMG//

The computer incident response team at a multinational company has determined that a breach of sensitive data has occurred in which a threat actor has compromised the organization's email system. Per the incident response procedures, this breach requires notifying the board immediately. Which of the following would be the BEST method of communication?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"notifying the board Immediately". C is the answer

For sure we cannot use email as it has been compromised. 
The choice between externally hosted instant message and VoIP depends on what agreed in communication plan. 
Both VoIP and instant messaging application may use encryption and are a way to communicate.
I choose D

comments.content: The statement "threat actor has compromised the organization's email system", so why are you still selecting corporate-hosted encrypted email? Furthermore, it also state notifying the board immediately. Therefore C is the answer.

discussion.content: answer is B

comments.content: yeah, would have thought encrypted comms would be the way to go... voip can be spoofed easily, don't think it's the right choice

The statement "threat actor has compromised the organization's email system", so why are you still selecting corporate-hosted encrypted email? Furthermore, it also state notifying the board immediately. Therefore C is the answer.

The statement "threat actor has compromised the organization's email system", so why are you still selecting cooperate-hosted encrypted email? Furthermore, it also state notifying the board immediately. Therefore C is the answer.
What answer did you choose? Making a phone call seems strange. What about B ?

discussion.content: This question was on the exam

questions.question_text: A malicious hacker wants to gather guest credentials on a hotel 802.11 network. Which of the following tools is the malicious hacker going to use to gain access to information found on the hotel network?

comments.content:
That's right.

It literally says on https://www.aircrack-ng.org/ that 

"It focuses on different areas of WiFi security:
Monitoring: Packet capture and export of data to text files for further processing by third party tools
Attacking: Replay attacks, deauthentication, fake access points and others via packet injection
Testing: Checking WiFi cards and driver capabilities (capture and injection)
Cracking: WEP and WPA PSK (WPA 1 and 2)"

discussion.content:
I think the answer should be B: Aircrack-ng. It's made specifically for wifi networks. I havent been able to find anything that says Nikto does this. Just that is scans ports on web servers and verify server versions. Cant find are reason it would be A.

https://www.aircrack-ng.org/
I feel aircrack ng would be more appropriate in this case
Nikto is right

The Aircrack-ng suite of utilities (aircrack-ng.org) is one of the early tools designed for wireless network security testing. Aircrack-ng is made up of a number of command-line tools. The principal tools in the suite are as follows:

airmon-ng—Enable and disable monitor mode.
airodump-ng—Capture 802.11 frames. Use this output to identify the MAC address of the access point (its Basic Service Set ID) and the MAC address of a victim client device.
aireplay-ng—Inject frames to perform an attack to obtain the authentication credentials for an access point. This is usually performed using a deauthentication attack. Forcing the victim station to reauthenticate generates the required traffic. A deauthentication attack can also be used for DoS.

WiFi Specific Aircrack-ng
Aircrack-ng is an 802.11 WEP and WPA-PSK keys cracking program that can recover keys once enough data packets have been captured. It implements the standard FMS attack along with some optimizations like KoreK attacks, as well as the all-new PTW attack, thus making the attack much faster compared to other WEP cracking tools. In fact, Aircrack-ng is a set of tools for auditing wireless networks

Did anyone stop to think that the first part of the question is a red herring? He wants to gain access to information found on the Hotel Network... Does the Hotel have a web site? Nikto is a tool used to test web-specific vulnerabilities... SQL inj, XSS, cross script... mcvbm got it but it flew over the rest of your heads...
Aircrack for sure, option B.

tcpdump sounds too difficult. See here https://networkengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/19802/tcpdump-and-listening-to-wifi-traffic-of-others.
I would go for aircrack-ng. It is a more complete solution, being able to monitor, crack and attack.

First off this question is missing info, my thoughts:
tcpdump, if your trying capture traffic to get guest credentials from people staying at the hotel, aka logging into accounts through websites
or
Aircrack-ng if they are trying to get the password to get authenticated access to the Hotels network.
Nikto and Nessus you have 2 vulnerability scanners(nothing to do with the question)
The answer is Nikto because in the question it say "to gain access to information found on the hotel network?" Aircrack-ng is used for password cracking.

comments.content: He wants to GAIN ACCESS. NikTo is a vulnerability scanner (and it focusses mainly on webservers). The answer is NOT NikTo, I can guarantee that.

discussion.content: says nothing at all about wifi, therefore aircrack is not right. Think the answer is nikto

comments.content: The reason why those websites all provide the same answers is very simple: They copied one another. Copied without providing any kind of information as of why that particular answer is correct. At least here, on this website, you can discuss it with other people. :)
ah yeah my bad. strange how every site points to nikto, but aircrack is obvious wifi cracking tool in kali. makes you think how accurate these q&a's are

discussion.content:
I think it is tcpdump! This would packet capture the info. Nikto is a web vulnerability scanner.
Am I wrong?

comments.content: While tcpdump can allow you to capture packets, this is pretty much useless of communication is encrypted. Aircrack-ng would be the best choice since it offers a suite of tools for wireless network monitoring and attack related tools.
